title: Set up your first 3D printer
body: Someone offers you a 3D printer. Do you accept?

options.title: Accept 3D printer
options.body: You graciously accept the big box they're offering you.

options.title: Reject offer
options.body: Maybe later.

options.title: Before we get started, let's make sure we're complying with the FAA.
options.body: Even in amateur rocketry, above a certain threshold, you need to register your rocket with the FAA and obtain a certificate.

options.title: According to the FAA, the rocket may weigh no more than 1500 grams, with a maximum weight of 125g of propellant.
options.body: Let's try 3D printing one and choosing parts that comply with FAA regulations.

steps.message: We're gonna 3D print the rocket and buy a couple hobby rocket motors from Amazing.

options.title: 3D print a nosecone
options.body: It needs to be pointy!

options.title: 3D print a body tube
options.body: You could technically print multiple body tubes to make a longer rocket, but let's not get that fancy just yet.

options.title: 3D print a fincan
options.body: The fincan has holes for 2 rocket motors.

options.title: 3D print a nosecone coupler
options.body: This'll be superglued to the nosecone and fastened to the body tube using non-flammable cord.

options.title: Great! We're gonna need a few more things:
options.body: Some superglue, some non-flammable cord, an igniter, a launch controller, and some rocket motors.

options.title: Buy superglue
options.body: This'll be used to glue the nosecone to the nosecone coupler.

options.title: Buy kevlar cord
options.body: This'll be used to fasten the nosecone coupler to the body tube. 1 meter should do it.

options.title: Buy an igniter
options.body: This'll be used to ignite the rocket motors.

options.title: Buy a launch controller
options.body: This'll be used to control the launch sequence.

options.title: Buy 2 motors
options.body: Each of these weighs 58.1 grams, so combined, they'll just barely be within the 125g FAA limit.

options.title: Great! We're almost ready to launch.
options.body: Let's assemble the rocket and launch it.

options.title: Ok, let's find a launch site.
options.body: As soon as we find a safe place, we can launch the rocket.

options.title: Launch the rocket!
options.body: Make sure you don't break any laws.

options.title: You did it! Maybe next time we'll use a parachute to recover the rocket.
options.body: Click here to finish the request and receive your award.

title: Grow basil hydroponically
body: Hydroponics is a technique by which you grow plants in a liquid nutrition solution. No soil required. Very water-efficient.

options.title: Next we're gonna prepare some some water for hydroponics.
options.body: The simplest way to do this is to fill a bucket with tap water and set it outside for a couple days to dechlorinate.

options.title: Find your sink
options.body: It's gotta be in here somewhere...

options.title: Order some basil seeds
options.body: 1 packet of seeds should be enough!

options.title: Order some rockwool
options.body: The Real Hydroponics Tub 1 has 11 slots for rockwool. That's how many you'll need.

options.title: Order some hydroponics nutrients
options.body: Your plant will need this to grow and stay alive.

options.title: Buy a bucket
options.body: You're gonna need to set a bucket of water outside for a few days to dechlorinate.

options.title: Oh yeah, you'll also need artificial lighting since we're growing indoors for now.
options.body: This lamp is perfect for growing basil indoors. You only need one.

options.title: Place a few basil seeds in each of the 11 hydroponic starter plugs.
options.body: They should turn into seedlings in 7 days. You can place them in a sunny window.

options.title: Dip 11 hydroponic starter plugs in the dechlorinated bucket of water.
options.body: This will help the water soak through them for germination.

options.title: Place the bucket in direct sunlight for 48 hours
options.body: This will dechlorinate the water and make it suitable for hydroponics.

options.title: Add tap water to the bucket
Generate dWatt until we have at least 16,128.
options.body: The dCarbon we're generating isn't ideal, but we'll fix that later.

options.title: Alright, we've got everything we need!
options.body: Let's set everything up and start growing! Starting with the the hydroponic tub...

options.title: Now that our tub is ready, let's start the growing process!
options.body: The lights are set to stay on for 16 hours a day, so you don't have to worry about that.

options.title: Finally, let's harvest the basil, which should be ready to sell!
options.body: Harvest all 11 plants to proceed and finish the quest.

options.title: Done! You can continue growing basil on the Machines page!
options.body: Click here to finish the quest and receive your reward.

title: Buy the Hypercar
body: It's cyber (*cough*) I mean hyper, but not a truck.

options.title: Order a Hypercar from Amazing
options.body: Driven to your door.

options.title: Receive a commemorative award for your purchase of the Hypercar
options.body: You're an early adopter!

title: Make a test print
body: You can use the 3D printer you received in the previous quest.

options.title: Print a Benchy
options.body: A popular test print.

options.title: Turn in your benchy for a benchy award
options.body: Shiny!

title: 3D print a model rocket
body: A nice (non-functioning) knick knack for your shelf or desk.

options.title: Turn in your 3D printed rocket for a trophy!
options.body: (I'm basically implementing achievements as items until I build a proper achievement system)

options.title: You'll need at least 91g of PLA filament.

title: Here, have a smart plug
body: You'll need this to generate dWatt.

options.title: Take the smart plug
options.body: Go to the Energy page to learn more about generating dWatt.

title: A stranger offers you a box and says there's a hydroponics tub inside.
body: Why are people just giving you things???

options.title: Take the box and unbox it.

title: A stranger hands you a crisp 1000 dUSD bill.
body: This is because there's no good dUSD farm in the game yet and I want you to have nice things now! Future balance update me will hate this.

options.title: Put the money in your wallet

title: Let's make things more sustainable.
body: Generating dWatt using your outlet is a great way to get started, but unfortunately your utility company uses fossil fuels for electricity generation. This means that you're also generating dCarbon! Let's fix that.

options.title: Buy a solar panel.
options.body: This 200W one should do!

options.title: Buy a battery pack.
options.body: This one is a bit pricey, but it'll allow you to generate up to 1000 dWatt at a time.

options.title: Place the solar panel outside, connect the battery, and generate 1000 dWatt.
When you're ready, finish this quest for a commemorative trophy!
options.body: You can generate dWatt using solar anytime on the Energy page!

title: You've completed the first batch of quests!
body: You qualify for a special trophy!

title: Set up an aquarium for a goldfish
body: A nice addition to any room. Plus, aquaria plays an important symbiotic role with hydroponics, which we'll explore later.

options.title: Set up an aquarium
options.body: You can click on each item on the process page to buy it. If there's no buy link, you need to complete some other process on the Machines page.

options.title: Feed your goldfish
options.body: You should feed your goldfish 2-3 times per day.

options.title: Receive your reward
options.body: Make sure to take care of it!

title: Let's launch another rocket, but this time with a parachute.

options.title: A parachute should reduce our velocity and prevent substantial damage to the rocket.
options.body: The parachute is reusable too!

options.title: We'll just combine a parachute with an otherwise fully assembled model rocket.
Ok, we're ready for launch. Let's do this!
options.body: If you are missing an item you can either click on it and buy it, or manufacture it on the Machines page.

options.title: Finish the quest
options.body: You can always use the machines page to make and launch more rockets.

title: You've probably accumulated dCarbon.
body: If so, you can convert it to dOffset using dUSD. You can do that any time on the Machines page as well, but let's get started converting it now.

options.title: Convert dCarbon to dOffset
options.body: All you need is some dUSD, and of course, dCarbon.

options.title: You did it! That money will help other people offset their carbon emissions with solar and wind.
options.body: You can always use the Energy page to convert more dCarbon.

title: Did you know you can earn some basic income?
body: It's not much, but you can earn income every week, no strings attached. Just start the 7-day process on the Wallet page and you'll get your dUSD at the end.

options.title: Just start the process and your 100 dUSD will be ready to collect after 7 days!
options.body: The amount per week is subject to change.

options.title: You did it! You earned some basic income.
options.body: You can always use the Wallet page to start the process again.

title: Charge your EV at home
body: Now that you've got an EV, you can charge at home with an EV charger. This'll be much more economical long term than relying on public chargers.

options.title: Now that you've got a charger, you can charge your EV using dWatt.
options.body: You can also find the charger on the Machines page.

options.title: You did it! You charged your EV at home.
options.body: You can always use the EV charger on the Machines page to charge your EV again.

title: Let's scale up our solar panel grid.
body: Let's set up 5 solar panels and buy a 1kWh battery to store the energy.

options.title: Make sure you have at least 1kW of solar panels total.
Now that we've got the required materials, we can generate more dWatt per hour with solar.
options.body: Start the process

options.title: Whenever you're ready, you can finish the quest and collect your rewards.
options.body: You can always use the Energy page to generate more dWatt with solar.
